posts.title: Building My First GraphQL API
posts.content: Just finished implementing my first GraphQL server with Apollo! The type safety and query flexibility is amazing. Can't believe I waited so long to try it. What are your favorite GraphQL tools?

posts.title: TypeScript Best Practices
posts.content: After working with TS for 3 years, here are my top tips: 1) Use strict mode from day one 2) Leverage union types 3) Don't fight the compiler 4) Use type guards effectively. What would you add?

posts.title: React Server Components Deep Dive
posts.content: Spent the weekend exploring RSCs and I'm blown away by the performance improvements. The ability to fetch data at the component level while maintaining SEO is a game changer. Here's what I learned...

posts.title: Why I Switched from REST to GraphQL
posts.content: Made the transition last month and here's why it was worth it: Single endpoint, no over-fetching, strongly typed, amazing tooling. The developer experience is just superior in every way.

posts.title: Node.js Performance Tips
posts.content: Optimizing a Node app to handle 10k concurrent users taught me a lot. Key lessons: use clustering, implement proper caching, profile your code, and always use connection pooling for databases.

posts.title: UX Design Principles That Every Developer Should Know
posts.content: As developers, we often focus on the code and forget about the user. Here are 5 UX principles that transformed how I build interfaces: 1) Less is more 2) Consistency is key 3) Feedback is essential...

posts.title: Designing for Accessibility from Day One
posts.content: Web accessibility isn't an afterthought - it should be built in from the start. Here's my checklist: semantic HTML, proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, color contrast, and screen reader testing. Everyone deserves great UX!

posts.title: The Psychology of Color in UI Design
posts.content: Color choices can make or break your user interface. Blue builds trust, green suggests success, red demands attention. But context matters more than the color itself. Here's how I approach color psychology...

posts.title: Microservices vs Monolith: When to Choose What
posts.content: The age-old debate! After working with both architectures, here's my take: Start with a monolith, split when you have clear domain boundaries, and remember that complexity is the real enemy, not architecture choice.

posts.title: Kubernetes Production Lessons Learned
posts.content: Just hit our 1-year anniversary running K8s in production. Here are the hard-won lessons: resource limits save you money, health checks save your sleep, and monitoring saves your sanity. Details below...

comments.content: Great post! I had similar experiences when I first tried GraphQL. The learning curve was worth it.
Apollo Client has been a game changer for me. The caching layer alone is worth the switch.
I'd add 'prefer type assertions over any' to your TypeScript tips. Saved me so many runtime errors!
Union types are so powerful once you understand them. Great advice!
RSCs are definitely the future. The mental model shift takes time but it's worth it.
This resonates so much! The over-fetching problem in REST APIs was driving me crazy.
Connection pooling tip is gold! Made such a difference in our app performance.
As a developer, I really needed to hear this. UX should never be an afterthought.
Accessibility testing with actual screen readers was eye-opening for our team.
The monolith vs microservices debate never gets old! Context is everything.
